column4: i can't find a connection when i set a static lan ip in network admin. i can has halp plz?
what ip address are you giving your self
is your router giving out dhcp addresses still ?
thats why then, that address conflicts with the dhcp range
you need to shorten the dhcp range on your router, or reserve a set of addresses to that the router doesn't use them
hmm. i remember i used to use 1.3 though .... weird
you can use them, if the router doesn't have a lease on that address,
looks like dhcp is assigning addresses above 192.168.1.100 only
then the issue is either your subnet/gateway is wrong, or your router config is wrong
the gateway address i know is right. guess it could be the router config. was hoping it was something tricky with the network-admin config - that's easier to get help for =#
view it with ifconfig - check your factual config
